ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: 1) The readings are unnecessary because there's no room for discussion, nor are they relevant to the midterm. There was no final. They're interesting on their own, but it's hard to evaluate their value since their only benefit is personal.9) Field trips were poorly scheduled (Friday during reading week was hard, though I understand the challenge of coordinating with silvi trips). Also, the professor's desire to re-explain everything our hosts were saying diminished opportunities to learn from them. The professor was also not very sensitive to students' schedules.
Speakers we really good. But I think the class teaching method can improve and have more real life cases.
Presentation gave by students and professor's comments on the topics
The subject matter, and the fact that the professor knows a great deal about the topic.
the guest speakers were a great addition!
Speakers and field trip
I really enjoyed the instructor's energy and lecturing style, and all of the real-world examples and stories she told to illustrate the lecture.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Teaching methodology -- all you really need to do is read the slides.Keeping to the class time -- ending 10 or 15 minutes late is challenging when students have other classes or jobs to go to.
Class methodology
Time management -- I know class always started late, but it was still frustrating to have it end late all the time!

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Comments on the seminar topics
I did not reach out to the professor for assistance at any point. The TA was helpful when asked.
Good quality
Very accessible! The instructor was very kind to lend out her personal books, and the TA provided helpful advice also.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Restoration is one of the most important parts of forest management. Thus, the class helped me a lot to develop my forest management skills.
I feel as though my time could have been better spent in another course.
This course was related to my thesis topic, and this course helped to provide more of the scientific background I needed to analyze my data.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I was interested in the topic.
I am interested in the management of urban ecosystems.
Wanted to know more about the topic

I have been wanting to take a course from this instructor for a long time now, and I chose this course because it is most relevant to my thesis research and I know the instructor has deep expertise on this topic.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes! It was very practical, because professor showed us case studies that she has done and talked about the challenges that was very helpful.
No.
Overall, yes.

The course exceeded my expectations, because I also was able to learn a lot about Latin America which is not my region of expertise. This was very useful for me, because it's important to have basic knowledge of ecological and social dynamics in all regions of the world.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Not really.
Yes overall.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Get some help from professor preparing presentations so that they can focus on restoration strategies.
Do the readings independently. Or audit.
Don't miss the field trips
Take advantage of the instructor by meeting with her for office hours to get advice on your presentation topic.
